

# analysis of foot in still condition with filter 

## setup
```{python}
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from scipy.signal import butter, filtfilt

with open("./still-w-filter.txt", "r") as f:
		data = f.readlines()
		data = [line for line in data if line.strip()]  # Remove empty lines
		data = data[1:]  # Skip header line
		time = np.array([int(line.strip().split(",")[0]) for line in data])
		data = [list(map(float, line.strip().split(",")[1:])) for line in data]
		dt = np.array([line[0] for line in data])
		fsr1 = np.array([line[1] for line in data])
		fsr1_filt = np.array([line[2] for line in data])
		fsr2 = np.array([line[3] for line in data])
		fsr2_filt = np.array([line[4] for line in data])
		fsr3 = np.array([line[5] for line in data])
		fsr3_filt = np.array([line[6] for line in data])
		fsr4 = np.array([line[7] for line in data])
		fsr4_filt = np.array([line[8] for line in data])
		fsr5 = np.array([line[9] for line in data])
		fsr5_filt = np.array([line[10] for line in data])
		pos = np.array([line[11] for line in data])
		vel = np.array([line[12] for line in data])
		vel_filt = np.array([line[13] for line in data])
		acc = np.array([line[14] for line in data])
		acc_filt = np.array([line[15] for line in data])
adt = np.mean(np.diff(dt))  # main time difference
fs = 1 / adt  # sampling frequency in Hz
```

## FSR1 and filtered FSR1 over time
```{python}
plt.plot(time, fsr1, label='FSR1', color='blue', alpha=0.5)
plt.plot(time, fsr1_filt, label='Filtered FSR1', color='red')
plt.title('FSR1 vs Time')
plt.xlabel('Time (ms)')
plt.ylabel('FSR1 (units)')
plt.legend()
plt.show()
```

## dft of FSR1 data
```{python}
fsr1_dft = np.fft.fft(fsr1)
freqs = np.fft.fftfreq(len(fsr1), d=adt)
plt.plot(freqs, np.abs(fsr1_dft), color='blue')
plt.title('DFT of FSR1 Data')
plt.xlabel('Frequency (Hz)')
plt.ylabel('Magnitude')
plt.show()
```

## dft of filtered FSR1 data
```{python}
fsr1_filt_dft = np.fft.fft(fsr1_filt)
plt.plot(freqs, np.abs(fsr1_filt_dft), color='red')
plt.title('DFT of Filtered FSR1 Data')
plt.xlabel('Frequency (Hz)')
plt.ylabel('Magnitude')
plt.show()
```
